Description: Painted sycomore fig wood shabti with a yellow and blue lappet-wig, a carved face with the eyes traced with black and pierced ears, a red and blue collar, crossed hands in relief holding two red hoes, the body is white, the backs of the arms are decorated with two representations of red seed-baskets, the feet are divided with a groove.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
